q: And so it went. Stephanopoulos asked Donald Rumsfeld to concede that if he'd stayed in office after 2006,`` there would have been defeat in Iraq and the surge would not have taken place.'' Donald Rumsfeld : Oh, no, absolutely not. Stephanopoulos:`` Why is it so difficult, sir, for you to say,` This is the mistake I made. This is what we should have done different. throws, grabbing eight rebounds before exiting with 2:34 left and the Sixers leading 106-87. Allen Iverson said he did not mind sitting out the final minutes of a blowout victory instead of attempting to set a career high. Honestly, and I can't be any truer than this, all I wanted was for the Milwaukee Bucks to be down one point once there were all zeroes on the board, he said. The Sixers blew a 19-point, fourth-quarter lead in an overtime loss to New York on Friday night. by tea party activists and others- have pledged to reverse this dangerous trend of wasteful federal spending in an effort to place the nation on the path toward fiscal sanity. Veteran Indiana Congressman Mike Pence said: Any increase in the debt ceiling should be married to very real and significant reductions in spending in the short term and the long term.
